headline: Cinnamon Rolls
description: This cinnamon roll recipe starts with an easy bread machine dough that's filled, rolled, and proofed — then baked for just 15 minutes in the oven.

video.description: Make your own mall-style cinnamon rolls!
video.name: Cinnamon Rolls III

name: Cinnamon Rolls
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dough: Place milk, water, melted butter, egg, bread flour, pudding mix, sugar, salt, and yeast into a bread machine in the order listed, or follow the order recommended by the manufacturer if different. Run Dough cycle. Remove dough from the machine after the cycle is done, about 90 minutes.
When the dough is almost finished, start the filling: Mix brown sugar, pecans, and cinnamon together in a bowl until well combined. Butter a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll into a 17x10-inch rectangle. Spread 1/2 cup softened butter over the rectangle, then sprinkle brown sugar mixture over top.

Beginning with the long side, roll dough over filling into a log; cut log into sixteen 1-inch slices. Place slices, cut-sides up, into the prepared pan. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
While the rolls are cooling, make the frosting: Stir confectioners' sugar, softened butter, cream cheese, milk, and vanilla together in a bowl until well combined. Spread over warm rolls.

review.reviewBody: I didn’t use a bread machine to make these so I wasn’t sure if they’d turn out correctly, but this recipe made one of the best cinnamon rolls I’ve ever had! They came out light and fluffy even though they’re not huge rolls and the icing is absolutely delicious- I’m definitely going to make these again!
Excellent recipe. I think the Instant pudding and Bread flour made the difference! Taste was so good!
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!
Use at least 3/4 packet of pudding for moister rolls. Takes 4 hours for rolls to rise from room temp,
I really loved this recipe. It was really simple to follow and made soft, beautiful cinnamon rolls.
The best one I have ever had the pleasure of making and friends and family just love them

Rolls came out delightful and fluffy. Followed recipe best I could. I don’t have a bread machine so I used my stand mixer and I didn’t have bread flour so I used all purpose. Delicious and would make again!
45 min was not long enough for the rising. But came out good and fluffy! Defiantly will use this and have the bread maker make the dough!
Very good, would make again.
Not sure exactly what I didn’t do correctly, but my dough was unusable (dry... SO dry), so I put in my stand mixer and put a little water and milk in
I made these on Christmas Eve and cooked them for Christmas Brunch. My family loved them. I will be making these again.

These cinnamon rolls are amazing and have become my go-to whenever my family wants cinnamon rolls. They are hands down my family’s favorite and whenever we have potlucks -I bring these and everyone always asks for the recipe!! So Delicious! Originally, I made them by hand and then with my bread machine when I bought one. The bread machine definitely makes these rolls so much simpler since it does most of the work. I do double the filling as suggested since my family just loves them with more gooey cinnamon filling but they are also good as written! Last time I made them, I separated them into 2 separate pans-one to stay home for my family and one to take over to my in-laws.
Made these for my family and they are delicious! Didn’t change a thing.

Ok, without a doubt, I was skeptical that these warranted the five star rating. Now after making this recipe, there are not enough stars in the sky for this one. 
Two mods - this New England yankee won't afford cool appliances like a bread machine. I worked this dough by hand. Two, I added slivered (yes, slivered) raisins and finely chopped walnuts to one of the logs. The other was per recipe. The differences in taste and chew were marked. My wife passed on the raisin/walnut version. I tried both and greatly preferred the added goodies.
Amazingly good! Compared with other recipes and this one is still the crowd pleaser by far.
I had a great recipe, but this is better! Followed it to a T. Thank you!
Absolutely delicious!! I don’t have a bread machine, but my stand mixer worked wonderfully. The dough was a dream to work with. Truly a keeper!
Delicious! That’s all I can say!

This was SO good! I've never made Cinnamon rolls from scratch before but the rolls themselves AND the icing was delicious. This will be my go to for cinnamon rolls for the future. I didn't make any changes to the ingredients. I didn't have a bread maker so I followed a reviewers instructions on how to do it manually. I laid out those instructions a little bit clearer below.

Modified Directions (without bread maker)
Step A
Dissolve 1 tbsp. white sugar in 1/4 cup warm water with 1/4 cup melted butter. Stir, add packet of yeast. Cover and set aside.

Step B
Mix 1 egg, 1/2 package of pudding mix and 1 cup of warm milk. Wisk. Measure out flour in separate bowl.

Step C
Mix yeast mixture and pudding mixture together, mixing well. Add flour. Kneed the dough until it forms a ball. Cover bowl and put it in a warm place to rise for about an hour.

Pick up at step 2 of the original directions.
1st time ever making cinnamon rolls. Turned out perfect!

These were gooey and delicious. I accidentally added the whole package of pudding but they turned out great anyway. Thanks to the reviewers that gave advice to those of us without a bread machine, very helpful
Gooey and delicious!

Amazing recipe! I followed the top comments suggestions and also added 1tsp of vanilla extract to the pudding mixture before adding the yeast. I used far more brown sugar and cinnamon (more like 2 cups and 3 tbs) than the recipe calls for which provided that gooey brown sugar on the bottom of the rolls! Delicious!

Loved these cinnamon rolls! I was out of bread flour (and so was the grocery store) so I used AP flour. They turned out great. Using the bread machine was so convenient and time saving. I will definitely be making these cinnamon rolls more often.

Oh my... just delicious. It is a time consuming labor of love, but it worked awesome. I followed the directions for the full recipe, and then took the second half of the roll and put it in a jar with parchment to be frozen and made later. It worked pretty well once I got it out of the jar
So good! Highly recommend. Takes time but worth the effort.

This is the first time I've ever made cinnamon rolls, and they came out really good. I made the dough the night before, rolled them up, and placed it in the fridge. The hardest part was in rolling the dough on the pan. The recipe doesn't include icing, and it definitely needs to have icing. My wife thought these were as good as Cinnabon.
awful at best.
In case anyone is wondering, I used all purpose flour and it came out just fine. Also, I doubled the Vanilla (preference), but otherwise made it as stated and they were outstanding!
Dough moist can improve, but other than that, PERFECT!
I used a mixer with a dough hook and they came out great!

These were good. I think I liked cinnamon rolls II better because here, 4 cups of flour only made 15 rolls where the other recipe had 6 cups of flour and made 30 rolls. I don't know what else made the difference, but for the work, I'd rather the other rolls. Also, I don't always have pudding mix on hand. I baked them at 375 for 18 minutes. Everyone loved them. They really were yummy. No frosting needed.
Amazing taste and very easy to complete. I let the dough rise more than once before forming the rolls which may not have been good idea but they taste incredible! Will definitely do this one again.
absolutely delicious...this was my first time using my bread machine ever...i used self rising flour and yeast and they turned out perfect
Best recipe and most requested in my home.
One of the favorite cinnamon roll recipes I've tried! I used a buttercream frosting instead of the cream cheese frosting and it was delicious! Find the buttercream frosting on this website as well.
Best cinnamon bun recipe I’ve ever made! I don’t have a bread machine so kneaded the dough the traditional way. Didn’t have pecans so doubled the filling.
Yes ill make it again
my only recipe i use for cinnamon rolls the best one i have found

These turned out absolutely perfect. The only thing I changed was to leave the vanilla pudding out, because I didn’t have any. I froze half the batch (8 rolls) - before rising - along with the frosting. Next time I want them, all I have to do is thaw, allow to rise, and bake!

I made these today and they were a hit. It wasn't until half way through kneading that I realized that I forgot the vanilla pudding. Next time I make I will include that and see how much different they are. But this is definitely a keeper.
We used chocolate pudding which darkened the dough - delicious!

As noted, very easy and most importantly, very tasty. Be sure to follow exact order. I mistakenly melted butter into icing sugar, vanilla resulting in runny filling. Made for messy bun rolling however taste was fine.
No changes and have made a couple more times

I made this without benefit of a bread maker and it turned out great! After combining the first nine ingredients, I used a dough hook and my trusty Kitchenaid to knead the dough until springy (about 10 minutes). I then turned it into a greased bowl, covered it with greased plastic wrap and allowed it to proof for an hour, until doubled. I then punched the dough down and allowed it to proof for another hour. The rest of the recipe was followed as written.
Very good made it exactly just doubled the frosting cause I love frosting.
Excellent recipe! I used 2 1/4 teaspoons of bread machine yeast and all purpose Canadian flour. These are absolutely delicious.

I have made this recipe a dozen times and these are hands-down the best cinnamon buns ever! To my surprise, I recently discovered that these can be made even better! I only had 2 cups of bread flour, so I added 2 cups all-purpose. These are even softer and better when I made them this way. I will continue to mix the types of flour, but as it is written, this is most definitely a 5 star recipe!

I have never writtten a review on this site before, but I feel like I need to for these cinnamon rolls. I have been making these rolls for 19 years! They are a Christmas morning tradition in our house. They do take some time, so planning ahead is key. For those of you that are worried about the time these rolls may take, here's what I do. I make these a day ahead and store them in the fridge, unbaked. The next morning, I put them in a warm oven to rise at about 200 degrees. After the rolls have risen, I bake and frost as directed. They are divine!! My family expects these every year. It wouldn't be Christmas without them!

author.name: My pot and perma garden Mary

review.reviewBody: My son is crazy about this recipe, I liked it, but was a bit to much vanilla tasting. I will tweak it to 1/4 pk of the vanilla pudding . The texture is very good and is simple to make. Will be my go to recipe for cinnamon rolls.

Cinnamon Roll III is delicious. My fiance' loves the taste. I will prepare again soon.

 Robin W
When I make these as I am going to make some today. I put snipped diced apples, and snipped raisins with the cinnamon and sugar mix. very good. drizzle with cream cheese frosting.

I do not own a bread maker so I used the dough hook on on my mixer and then followed the recipe exactly. The first time I made this recipe I put the dough in the fridge overnight before proofing it, they did not rise as much as subsequent times when I mixed, proofed, and baked them the same morning. Tasted very good, they are a go to treat for myself.

These cinnamon rolls where amazing and so delicious! I didn't have regular instant pudding mix so I just used sugar free instant pudding mix and it tasted fine. I also wanted to triple the batch but it didn't fit in my bread machine so I just used my mixer and then let it rise until the dough looked bigger and then I made the cinnamon rolls and then let them rise for 45 min and popped them in the oven. As for the icing i only had fat free cream cheese so i just used that, it was a little chunky but not super bad. Over all the cinnamon rolls where amazing! I even took them camping lol :)!
Made it as is, but subbed milk out for the same amount of unsweetened almond milk. A-mazing!

First time making cinnamon rolls and they came out perfect!! The only things I did differently was adding extra cinnamon and brown sugar and I used Paula Deen’s frosting recipe which is 2 cups of powdered sugar, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 4 tablespoons of butter, and 3-6 table spoons of hot water (I only needed 2).

I’ve tried quite a few different cinnamon roll recipes and this is by far my absolute favorite! Cinnamon rolls are one of my favorite sweet treats so the turnout of these made me very happy! So so so good!

My first time making these and they were amazing! I brought them to work and they got devoured! The only thing I did different was double the cinnamon mixture and mixed the butter right in with the filling. Going to make them again today for Easter morning
Wonderful except I recommend using a different recipe for the frosting. I took off one star because I didn't care for the frosting that much.

This is my new cinnamon roll recipe. The whole time I kept thinking that my dough did not turn out well. But in reality, the Dough was beautiful and the rolls turned out gorgeous and tasted like a little piece of heaven. Everyone in my household loved them, even the baby.

These are without a doubt AMAZING! I followed the advice of other reviewers because I do not have a bread machine. I also used a whole box of pudding. AND I used all purpose flour. Thank you to all the reviewers who posted reviews with ways to make all this possible. I used another recipe for the icing, but the cinnamon rolls are definitely the best!

These turned out fantastic! My family loved them. I left out the pecans because my family doesn’t like nuts, but it didn’t matter. These are the bomb! I made the dough in my bread machine and got the cinnamon rolls all cut and ready to go on a cookie sheet, then covered and placed in the refrigerator overnight. Pulled them out in the morning and let them rise while the oven preheated. Took about 20 minutes to bake. I whipped up the icing and placed in a ziplock bag and just snipped the corner for easy spreading onto the rolls. Will be making these again! Thank you!
perfect recipe

Really delicious recipe. Turned out perfect my first attempt. My only deviation was to add 2 eggs because the eggs I had on hand were a bit small. The other adjustment was to the frosting. I used less powdered sugar than the recipe called for. I would suggest adding half a cup of sugar and then adding a little at a time until you find your perfect level of sweetness.
My family loved them
They were delicious, and although they don't need frosting, a think a little drizzle would have made them just a little more yummy!
I didn’t have a packet of vanilla pudding, but I made them anyway. Added a little extra sugar, about two tablespoons. The recipe was delicious and easy to follow.

I really like this recipe, I have made it twice now. This time I used French vanilla pudding and mixed up the butter, brown sugar and cinnamon together before smearing it on the dough. I put some of the frosting on the rolls when they came out of the oven and then the rest after they cooled.

It was very tasty, but not soft like my family likes them. The bread flour makes them more dense. Later that day, they became hard. Just substituted all purpose flour the second time I made them, and were soft and delicious.
My new favorite cinnamon roll recipe.

So delish! I added a teaspoon of nutmeg to the cinnamon as someone had suggested and they are amazing! Soft but not “undone” tasting. Struggled a little with closing once rolled up but I just went with it and didn’t worry, as this is my first attempt with cinnamon rolls ever.
Yum!

Excellent and easy recipe.
My family loves it!
Amazing! Everyone in my family loves these!

These were a big hit in our house. My hubby, who eats very healthy and doesn't even care for cinnamon rolls, had 2 or 3. It made about 16 large rolls. Requires a bit of planning, but totally worth it. Rolled them the night before, covered with plastic in the fridge, and let them thaw and rise about an hour before baking. Will definitely make again.

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! These cinnamon rolls were delicious! I was always afraid to even try making cinnamon rolls but I wanted something special to make for my wife and daughter on Christmas morning. I’m so glad I manned up and took the leap of faith. These cinnamon rolls were really easy to make. I actually made them three days ahead and froze them before giving them the opportunity to raise in the pan. I pulled them back out of the freezer after my family went to bed on Christmas Eve and let them thaw and rise at room temperature over night. I woke up early to baked and glazed them before they woke up. What a surprise! They LOVED them! I followed this recipe exactly except for the nuts, we don’t like them in baked recipes. Thanks again. You really gave this family such Joy on Christmas morning.

They did taste a lot like Cinnabon’s! I used the whole package of pudding & left out the 1 tbsp. sugar, used 1/3 c. dry milk powder & water for the fresh milk, increased the salt to 1 tsp. and added a couple Tablespoons of dry potato flakes to make them similar to the bread machine kolaches on this site, one of my favorite recipes. I added just a tsp. or 2 more cinnamon to the filling, too. 
Thanks for the recipe!
Perfect as is! Dough was incredibly easy to work with; used bread machine.

It is absolutely delicious!! The bread itself has a nice vanilla taste that’s really quaint but scrumptious. Of course using the bread machine makes this that much easier. I would suggest making the cinnamon and brown sugar into a paste before spreading it. Just mix it all in with your softened butter, it makes less mess when rolling and helps to make sure everything doesn’t slide to the bottom of the pan while doing the second rise and baking. I’ve already made this recipe twice and it is not my staple. My family has been requesting it like crazy! Thanks for sharing
These rolls are great, but I'm not giving credit to the person who posted it here, she copied and halved the recipe from another website which was posted years before this one.
I made my cinnamon rolls from scratch using this recipe and it came out perfect! They taste delicious!
I don't have a bread maker, so.... I mixed and I knead the dough by hand and they turned out really well. Also, I made the cream icing with. Yummy.
These are awesome. I did not use a bread machine but followed the suggestions that another baker posted.
Forgot to add in the egg and it turned out fine and still tasted amazing. If for some reason you dont want to add the egg or dont have any theres no need to worry haha
Made it using my mixer to knead the dough. Made the suggested cream cheese frosting and it was a perfect compliment. So easy my daughter made most of it with supervision from me. Everyone loved them!

I made this recipe with no changes and it is incredible! The dough came out perfectly in my breadmaker and they rose and baked beautifully! The pudding mix kept them moist and the cinnamon ratio is perfect. My husband loved them and I will definitely make these again soon.
I'll have to practice this so I can make it faster because it's so good.
Made these yesterday 8/3/2018, wow so delicious, Easy , will make again .
So easy and so fabulous! I made a pan and then cut them into individual rolls so I could freeze and enjoy at my leisure. Fantastic w/cream cheese frosting! Freezes quite well; reheat in microwave.

I came looking for instructions on how long to cook the cinnamon rolls that I bought in the store for. (The were frozen homemade cinnamon rolls, and there were no instructions.) I chose this recipe because it said it had the instrcutions to make the icing as well. The only problem is, the ingredients for the icing are mixed in with the ingredients for the cinnamon buns, which is very inconvenient. If there is a way to list them separately that would be much better. I will have to search for a recipe that’s just for the icing.
Very good, I also followed the non-machine instructions. Thanks!
They are wonderful but I will never go through that again! It took me ALL MORNING!!

Tried and true. These cinnamon rolls are better than any mall cinnamon roll I’ve ever had. I accidentally bought cook and serve pudding mix instead of instant and these still came out fantastic as always.
I will never use another cinnamon roll recipe again, these are amazing!

It came out amazing.
 I added all spice and pine nuts .

I made this almost sugar free. My substitutes:
Sugar Free Vanilla Pudding
Splenda Brown Sugar 
and Splenda Confectioners sugar. (take Splenda, put in food processer for a few min and you have confectioners sugar.)

You will use less Splenda than regular sugar so taste testing is required. 

Great flavor, light and fluffy buns.
It was just absolutely perfect! The dough was soft and sweet! My family is gobbling it up! We didn't have a dough maker but it did just fine in my kitchen aid mixer!

I’ve made the clone recipe a dozen or more times and it was good but not great. I thought it was my fault because of the 5 star rating. This recipe deserves the 5 stars!! I did add the whole box of pudding by mistake but they’re delicious so I’ll probably continue to add the whole box when I make them again and again and again.
I used the traditional method and they were incredible!
